Atomically replaces the value pointed by {{c|obj}} with the result of {{lc|std::min}} between the old value of {{c|obj}} and {{c|arg}}. Returns the value {{c|obj}} held previously. The operation is performed as if the following was executed:
@1,2@ {{c|obj-&gt;fetch_min(arg)}}
@3,4@ {{c|obj-&gt;fetch_min(arg, order)}}

If {{tt|std::atomic&lt;T&gt;}} has no {{tt|fetch_min}} member (this member is only provided for {{rlp|atomic#Specializations for integral types|integral}} and {{rlp|atomic#Partial specializations|pointer}} types except {{c/core|bool}}), the program is ill-formed.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|obj|pointer to the atomic object to modify}}
{{par|arg|the value to {{lc|std::min}} with the value stored in the atomic object}}
{{par|order|the memory synchronization ordering}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
The value immediately preceding the effects of this function in the {{lsd|cpp/atomic/memory order#Modification order}} of {{c|*obj}}.

===Notes===
{{feature test macro|__cpp_lib_atomic_min_max|Atomic minimum/maximum|value=202403L|std=C++26}}
